types

Class Type

  • java.lang.Object
    • types.Type
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ComparableType, UnusedType, VoidType

    public abstract class Type
extends java.lang.Object
    A type of the Kitten language.
    Author:
    Fausto Spoto

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract boolean canBeAssignedTo(Type other)
      Determines whether this type can be assigned to a given type.
      boolean canBeAssignedToSpecial(Type other)
      Determines whether this type can be assigned to a given type, by assuming that primitive types can only be assigned to the same, identical, primitive type.
      static ClassType getObjectType()
      Yields the top type of the hierarchy of the reference types.
      int getSize()
      The number of stack elements used on the Kitten abstract machine to hold a value of this type.

      Computes the least common supertype of a given type and this type.
      boolean subtypeOf(Type other)
      Determines whether this is a (non-strict) subtype of a given type.
      abstract org.apache.bcel.generic.Type toBCEL()
      Translates a Kitten type into its BCEL equivalent.
      abstract java.lang.String toString()

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getObjectType

        public static final ClassType getObjectType()
        Yields the top type of the hierarchy of the reference types.
        Returns:
        the top type

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        The number of stack elements used on the Kitten abstract machine to hold a value of this type. This is always 1 for Kitten types that are not void.
        Returns:
        the number of stack elements

      • toString

        public abstract java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • canBeAssignedTo

        public abstract boolean canBeAssignedTo(Type other)
        Determines whether this type can be assigned to a given type. Type void cannot be assigned to any type, not even to itself.
        Parameters:
        other - what this type should be assigned to
        Returns:
        true if the assignment is possible, false otherwise

      • subtypeOf

        public final boolean subtypeOf(Type other)
        Determines whether this is a (non-strict) subtype of a given type. It is exactly the same as canBeAssignedTo(Type).
        Parameters:
        other - what this type should be a (non-strict) subtype of
        Returns:
        true if this type is a (non-strict) subtype of other, false otherwise

      • canBeAssignedToSpecial

        public boolean canBeAssignedToSpecial(Type other)
        Determines whether this type can be assigned to a given type, by assuming that primitive types can only be assigned to the same, identical, primitive type. Moreover, it assumes that void is a subtype of itself.
        Parameters:
        other - what this type should be assigned to
        Returns:
        true if the assignment is possible, false otherwise

      • leastCommonSupertype

        public Type leastCommonSupertype(Type other)
        Computes the least common supertype of a given type and this type. That is, a common supertype which is the least amongst all possible supertypes.
        Parameters:
        other - the type whose least supertype with this type must be found
        Returns:
        the least common supertype of this type and other, if it exists, null otherwise (for instance, there is no least common supertype between boolean and int)

      • toBCEL

        public abstract org.apache.bcel.generic.Type toBCEL()
        Translates a Kitten type into its BCEL equivalent.
        Returns:
        the BCEL type corresponding to this Kitten type
